title: Gary Neville defends Jurgen Klopp's team selection in Liverpool's shock FA Cup loss to Wolves
text:

Gary Neville defended Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp's team selection in their shock FA Cup fourth-round defeat to Wolves. 
The Reds succumbed to their third home defeat in a week as Paul Lambert's side ensured a continuation to their miserable start to 2017. 
Liverpool have just once in eight games since the turn of the year - a run which has all but ended their hopes of silverware this season. 
Klopp named a much-changed starting line-up to the one that was knocked out of the EFL Cup by Southampton on Wednesday night, with Ben Woodburn, Connor Randall, Ovie Ejaria and Joe Gomez among nine alterations made by the German for Wolves' visit. 
After Lambert's men raced into a two-goal lead at Anfield, Klopp was accused of showing a lack of respect to the FA Cup by Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker. Klopp has an unlikely ally in Manchester United legend Gary Neville (Photo: Manchester Evening News) The Reds were outplayed by Championship opposition at Anfield (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
However, Neville defended Klopp by claiming it is right for managers to give youth players a chance in the cup competitions, the Liverpool Echo report. 
Neville tweeted: "Lots won't like this but weakened teams usually means young players getting a chance to shine. 
"It's the right thing for the FA cup. It's how I was given the chance to be a player. Getting a run out in cup games!!". 
Liverpool host Chelsea next at Anfield on Tuesday with a chance to reduce the Premier League leaders' 10-point gap at the top of the table. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
